PathAssistant.masterLabel: Variation from Client Template Legal Rev

pathAssistantSteps.info: The client or other party signs the Agreement, if acceptable. If the Agreement is sent by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the email and a copy of the Agreement is to be uploaded by the Researcher to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab) and notifies the Research Office contact via chatter.
The Variation is closed as it did not proceed to execution due to cancellation or withdrawal.
The Research Office reviews and updates the client or other party's Variation ready for signing. The Research Office Contact will contact the Researcher if there are further questions.

The client or other party returns the fully executed Agreement to the Research Office. The Research Office notifies the Researcher (via chatter) and a fully executed Agreement is uploaded to the Researcher Portal. If the fully executed Agreement has been returned to the Researcher, the Researcher uploads the email and a copy of the fully executed Agreement to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab) and notifies the Research Office contact via chatter.
The Research Office organises signing of the Agreement by an authorised signatory, once all parties have agreed to changes.
The Research Office refers the Variation to Legal Services. Legal Services reviews the client or other party's Variation and provides advice to the Research Office Contact and Researcher.

The Research Office prepares instructions for Variation including changes to Agreement timelines, milestones, project budget or expenditure, any changes to Agreement terms and conditions and deliverables/outputs. The Research Office completes instructions to Legal Services. The Research Office will contact the Researcher to clarify or to provide further details, if required.
The Research Office sends the draft Variation to the Researcher for their review or requests further instructions from the Researcher, if required.
The Research Office reviews Legal Services advice and updates the client or other party's Variation.

The Research Office sends the Variation to the client or other party (with a copy to the Researcher). If the Variation is sent by the Researcher to the client or other party, as agreed with the Research Office Contact, the email and a copy of the Variation is to be uploaded by the Researcher to the Researcher Portal (Related Tab under Files tab). The client or other party may decide to sign the Variation at this stage, if acceptable.
